Switching from aiming to hip-fire <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">does not disengage target-lock</> on headshots and weakspots.

Switching from one Smart weapon to another no longer interrupts target lock.

<Rich color="MainColors.Blue" style="Semi-Bold">Targeting Prism: </>Enables <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">multiple target locks</> when aiming, and increases the number of simultaneous targets for all Smart weapons by 1.

<Rich color="MainColors.Hacking" style="Semi-Bold">Unlocked Effect: </>While driving with a melee weapon and <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Tyger Claws Dermal Imprint</> equipped, gain up to <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">{float_0}% chance of blocking incoming bullets</>, increasing with driving speed.

The wheel is your weapon, the road your dojo. Tear through the streets with the ferocity of a Tyger Claw, leaving only carnage and the scent of burnt rubber in your wake.

Allows <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Kerenzikov</> to be activated when aiming and handbreaking simultaneously.

<Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">+25% weapon damage</> when your vehicle is drifting or airborne.

<Rich color="MainColors.Blue" style="Semi-Bold">Stuntjock: </>Unlocks preem <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">new ways to exit vehicles</>:
<Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Jump out</> - double-tap <Input context="VehicleDrive" actionName="QuickExit" color="MainColors.Blue" hold="Hide"></>
<Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Slide out</> - hold <Input context="VehicleDrive" actionName="QuickExit" color="MainColors.Blue" hold="Hide"></>while driving at high speed
You can also draw and fire weapons during these stunts.

<Rich color="MainColors.Blue" style="Semi-Bold">Deadeye: </><Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">+10% headshot and weakspot damage</> and <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">-25% Stamina cost for shooting.</>

Unlocks <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Deadeye</> mode, which is active above 85% Stamina. When active:

Neural Capacity

Chipware Expansion introduces Neural Capacity - a new resource representing your neural system health.\n\nYour Neural Processor is the primary source of Neural Capacity, which is drained during combat when activating cyberware such as a Sandevistan, Berserk, or Reflex Chips.
Memory Chips

Memory Chips slot into a Neural Processor at the cost of Cyberware Capacity.

They grant Perks and unique passive abilities that grow stronger with the chip’s Attunement level. While slotted, gaining experience in the related Skill increases Attunement, with higher tier Neural Processors accelerating progress.

Some Memory Chips have hidden abilities that can only be uncovered after fulfilling special requirements related to the theme of that chip.
Reflex Chips
Reflex Chips slot into a Neural Processor.\n\nThey grant activatable abilities in the form of Techniques, which are powerful maneuvers or buffs that typically cost Neural Capacity to activate.
Software Chips

Software Chips slot into a Neural Processor at the cost of RAM, and are disabled when running at negative RAM.

They provide a variety of different abilities that activate when some condition is met.

They require a valid License to operate, which typically expires after a number of uses and requires payment to renew. Cracking a chip bypasses the License requirement.

<Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">+{float_0}%</> to all cyberware <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">stat modifiers</>.
<Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">+{float_0} chipware slots</>.
Decreases Reflex Chip activation cost by <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">-{float_0}</>.
Neural Processor

Your Neural Processor is the heart of your neural system. It's the primary source of Neural Capacity, which is required to operate cyberware such as Sandevistan or Berserk. The green number on its tooltip indicates the amount of Neural Capacity it provides.\n\nIt can be slotted with numerous chips that provide a range of benefits to enhance your combat prowess, like activatable abilities or passive bonuses.
Max Attunement achieved!

Press <Input context="Locomotion" actionName="Dodge" color="MainColors.Blue" hold="Hide"></> to perform a Dash.

Dashing replaces dodging, allowing you to cover more ground and automatically vault over low obstacles.

<Rich color="MainColors.Blue" style="Semi-Bold">Air Dash: </><Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">-20% Dash Stamina cost</>

<Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">+20% Dash speed</>

Unlocks the ability to <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Dash in midair</>.

<Rich color="MainColors.Blue" style="Semi-Bold">Finisher - Live Wire: </>Unlocks a <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Monowire Finisher</>.

The more quickhacks you have queued on an enemy, the more susceptible they are.

Restores 15% Health and 5 RAM.

Updates the <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Jailbreak relic perk</> to upload the quickhack on both light and heavy attacks.
Optimizes the Monowire’s data throughput, ensuring all attack patterns interface with target systems.

Technique: Rebuke

<Rich color="MainColors.ActiveGreen">Technique: </>Grants <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">{float_0}% health as Adrenaline</>, and enables use of <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Quake</> with any melee weapon for {float_1} sec.

<Rich color="MainColors.Blue" style="Semi-Bold">Quake: </>Press <Input context="Combat" actionName="QuickMelee" color="MainColors.Blue" hold="Hide"></> to violently slam the ground, damaging and staggering nearby enemies with a chance of Knockdown. <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Quake</> can also be performed from midair (a <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Superhero Landing</>). <Rich color="TooltipText.cyberwareDescriptionHighlightColor" style="Semi-Bold">Cooldown:</> 10 sec.
